title: Class menu option
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the Scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps the options menu on the upper right hand corner of the app
custom_expected: Then a pop over should appear with six options: "Triple-A", "Double-A", "Class A Advanced", "Class A Full Season", "Class A Short Season", and "Rookie".

title: Selecting the same class
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in a specific class (i.e. Triple-A mode)
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the options menu on the top right corner 
And the user taps the same class the user is in (i.e. Triple-A) cell in the pop over
custom_expected:
Then the app should remain in same class (i.e. Triple-A) mode
And the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left on the Scoreboard
And the schedule on the page should reflect the same class (i.e. Triple-A) schedule for the given day.

Check for all classes and compare schedule on http://m.milb.com

title: Dismiss class menu option
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in either Triple-A, Double-A, Class A Advanced, Class A Full Season, Class A Short Season, or Rookie mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the options menu in the top right corner 
And the user taps outside the class selection pop over.
custom_expected:
Then the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left on the Scoreboard
And the schedule on the page should reflect the schedule for the day for the mode on which they were when they opened the pop over.

title: MiLB class selection
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in either Triple-A, Double-A, Class A Advanced, Class A Full Season, Class A Short Season, or Rookie mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the options menu on the in the top right corner
custom_expected: Then the mode which is currently active in the app (Triple-A, Double-A, Class A Advanced, Class A Full Season, Class A Short Season, or Rookie) should be clearly marked and visible. It should be immediately obvious to a first time user which mode is selected and which is deselected.

title: Verify Class
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in either Triple-A, Double-A, Class A Advanced, Class A Full Season, Class A Short Season, or Rookie mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the MiLB menu option in the top right corner 
And the user taps the either the Triple-A, Double-A, Class A Advanced, Class A Full Season, Class A Short Season, or Rookie cell in the pop over
custom_expected:
Then the user's selection should be clearly indicated to the user so they are immediately aware that the cell they chose has been selected.
And the scoreboard should reflect the games for the mode the user has chosen. 
And the schedule on the page should reflect the same class schedule for the given day.

Check for all classes and compare schedule on http://m.milb.com

title: Verify class in the rest of the app
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in a specific class mode (i.e Triple-A mode)
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to any section or page in the app, Check: 
Scoreboard, News, and Video
custom_expected:
Then the only data they should see should reference the selected class (i.e Triple-A) and teams in the selected class (i.e. Triple-A), all logos that appear should belong to that class (i.e Triple-A teams). 

Check for all classes.
